title: 3.6 Adolescent Brain
instructions: Choose the best answer to each question.

questions.question: What does brain "plasticity" mean?
questions.answer: The brain can change, adapt and respond to its environment

options.option: The brain is made up of oil, just like plastic is
The brain can be hard or soft depending on nutrition
The brain can be bent out of shape and then come back to its original shape

questions.question: Why does it take longer for signals to get to the front of the brain in teenagers?
questions.answer: The myelination process starts from the back of the brain then to the front

options.option: Their brains are smaller than adult brains.
Teenage brains do not have as much water in them
Sex hormones are affecting the brain.

questions.question: What causes the risk-taking behaviors that are so common among teenagers?
questions.answer: Communication between the limbic and prefrontal cortex is slow

options.option: They just want to have fun.
Teenagers don't get enough sleep and this affects their judgement

questions.question: Myelination in the brain.....
questions.answer: is a fatty layer around nerve cells that increases the speed of nerves

options.option: is a layer of special cells that slow down emotional feelings
is not fully developed until you are about 50 years old
is a special process that allows you to draw lines between you and others
